item.title: In Russia's Tech Center, Scientists Face Rewarding But Unpredictable Life
item.description: July 3, 2017 - Research institutes in Novosibirsk were built as innovation centers in the USSR. Despite the brain drain, scientists and techies remain, but life for successful entrepreneurs can be unpredictable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 3, 2017 - Research institutes in Novosibirsk were built as innovation centers in the USSR. Despite the brain drain, scientists and techies remain, but life for successful entrepreneurs can be unpredictable. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/03/535425954/in-russias-tech-center-scientists-face-rewarding-but-unpredictable-life

item.title: In Reno, Nev., Homegrown Startups Fuel Tech Transformation
item.description: July 3, 2017 - Reno, Nev., is enjoying a tech boom. Giants like Apple, Google and Tesla are all there. The transformation is also being driven by some homegrown start-ups, but some worry Reno will become unaffordable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 3, 2017 - Reno, Nev., is enjoying a tech boom. Giants like Apple, Google and Tesla are all there. The transformation is also being driven by some homegrown start-ups, but some worry Reno will become unaffordable. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/03/535408578/in-reno-nev-homegrown-startups-fuel-tech-transformation

item.title: A Remote Chinese Province Uses Its Climate To Grow A Big-Data Industry
item.description: July 3, 2017 - Southwest China's Guizhou province is one of the country's poorest, most remote regions. But Guizhou has some unique advantages, which it is trying to use to transform itself into a big-data hub.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 3, 2017 - Southwest China's Guizhou province is one of the country's poorest, most remote regions. But Guizhou has some unique advantages, which it is trying to use to transform itself into a big-data hub. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/03/535369266/a-remote-chinese-province-uses-its-climate-to-grow-a-big-data-industry

item.title: Tesla's Long-Awaited, Lower-Priced Model 3 To Arrive Friday
item.description: July 3, 2017 - The first of Tesla's significantly more affordable Model 3 cars should finish production by next weekend, CEO Elon Musk announced late Sunday.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 3, 2017 - The first of Tesla's significantly more affordable Model 3 cars should finish production by next weekend, CEO Elon Musk announced late Sunday. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/03/535333378/the-tesla-for-the-masses-to-arrive-friday

item.title: To Test Your Fake News Judgment, Play This Game
item.description:
July 3, 2017 - The journalist who thought up this game says she saw the need before "fake news" was even in the vernacular.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/07/03/533676536/test-your-fake-news-judgement-play-this-game

item.title: Video: Japan's 'Purikura' Photo Booths Offer Snapchat-Like Filters
item.description: July 3, 2017 - In NPR's Elise Tries series, correspondent Elise Hu tries out new experiences in East Asia. In Tokyo, she checks out Japanese purikura photo booths, which produce selfies to decorate and print out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 3, 2017 - In NPR's Elise Tries series, correspondent Elise Hu tries out new experiences in East Asia. In Tokyo, she checks out Japanese purikura photo booths, which produce selfies to decorate and print out. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/07/03/526005241/video-japans-purikura-photo-booths-offer-snapchat-like-filters

item.title: A Year Later, Pokémon Go Has Leveled Out And Left Fans Wanting More
item.description: July 1, 2017 - The nostalgia-fueled app caught the world's attention — sending people in search of the game's monsters. While millions still play, augmented-reality designers are thinking about the next big thing.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 1, 2017 - The nostalgia-fueled app caught the world's attention — sending people in search of the game's monsters. While millions still play, augmented-reality designers are thinking about the next big thing. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/01/534398812/a-year-later-pok-mon-go-has-leveled-out-and-left-fans-wanting-more

item.title: Germany Votes To Fine Social Media Companies For Failing To Remove Hate Speech
item.description: June 30, 2017 - The German parliament has voted to impose fines of up to $57 million on social media companies that fail to remove "obviously illegal" hate speech within 24 hours of it being posted.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - The German parliament has voted to impose fines of up to $57 million on social media companies that fail to remove "obviously illegal" hate speech within 24 hours of it being posted. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/30/535059262/germany-votes-to-fine-social-media-companies-for-failing-to-remove-hate-speech

item.title: Ukraine Cyberattack Wasn't Really About Ransom, Security Experts Say
item.description: June 30, 2017 - Although the virus that spread through government and commercial computers Tuesday looked like ransomware, cyber experts say it was a "wiper" intended to erase data and disrupt business.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - Although the virus that spread through government and commercial computers Tuesday looked like ransomware, cyber experts say it was a "wiper" intended to erase data and disrupt business. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/30/535043320/ukraine-cyberattack-wasnt-really-about-ransom-security-experts-say

item.title: Change My View On Reddit Helps People Challenge Their Own Opinions
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Four years ago, a Scottish teenager set out to do the impossible: cordon off a space for measured, civil conversation between people who believe different things — on the Internet! Now there are over 300,000 members of the Change My View subreddit. The founder talks about the surprising rules he had to implement in order to make the space work, and a researcher tells us who discovered a kind of agree-to-disagree inflection point by studying the group.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - Four years ago, a Scottish teenager set out to do the impossible: cordon off a space for measured, civil conversation between people who believe different things — on the Internet! The founder talks about the surprising rules he had to implement in order to make the space work, and a researcher tells us who discovered a kind of agree-to-disagree inflection point by studying the group. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/29/534916052/change-my-view-on-reddit-helps-people-challenge-their-own-opinions

item.title: Shadow Brokers Group Leaks Stolen National Security Agency Hacking Tools
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Last August, hacking tools were stolen from the National Security Agency. Now, those tools are being used in a number of cyber attacks around the world, and there's mounting pressure on the NSA to do something. NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Nicole Perlroth, who has been covering this for The New York Times.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Sony Will Start Making Vinyl Records Again In Japan, After A Nearly 30-Year Hiatus
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Sony says it's meeting new demand from young people who buy records they've heard on streaming services. The company stopped pressing vinyl in 1989.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - Sony says it's meeting new demand from young people who buy records they've heard on streaming services. The company stopped pressing vinyl in 1989. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/29/534854280/sony-will-start-making-vinyl-records-again-in-japan-after-nearly-30-year-hiatus

item.title: In China, A Cashless Trend Is Taking Hold With Mobile Payments
item.description: June 29, 2017 - Consumers there are finding convenience and security in using smartphones to pay. An estimated $5.5 trillion was spent through mobile platforms in 2016, about 50 times the amount in the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - Consumers there are finding convenience and security in using smartphones to pay. An estimated $5.5 trillion was spent through mobile platforms in 2016, about 50 times the amount in the U.S. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/29/534846403/in-china-a-cashless-trend-is-taking-hold-with-mobile-payments

item.title: How Europe Is Grappling With Increased Cybersecurity Threats
item.description: June 29, 2017 - European cybersecurity experts have been meeting in Brussels to discuss ways to combat recent attacks, including Tuesday's malware infection of thousands of business computers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 29, 2017 - European cybersecurity experts have been meeting in Brussels to discuss ways to combat recent attacks, including Tuesday's malware infection of thousands of business computers. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/29/534835108/how-europe-is-grappling-with-increased-threats-to-cybersecurity

item.title: Trump Picks Republican Lawyer For FCC Commissioner Seat
item.description: June 29, 2017 - President Trump will name former telecom attorney and current FCC lawyer Brendan Carr to serve as a commissioner. He is expected to back Chairman Ajit Pai's efforts to undo net neutrality rules.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

He is expected to back Chairman Ajit Pai's efforts to undo net neutrality rules. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/29/534828696/trump-picks-republican-lawyer-for-fcc-commissioner-seat
